teams.name: LOTUS: Lend Out To Uplift Self-sufficiency
teams.loan_because: We care about people striving to enhance their economic self-sufficiency and wish to support their entrepreneurial endeavors. It just takes one small step by each of us lending on kiva. Together we can make it easier for hard working people to get the much-needed capital to sustain and grow their business. We feel blessed to be able to support the aspirations of so many loan recipients who persevere tenaciously for a better quality of life with dignity. Kudos to Kiva.org that allows us to connect for this common cause.
teams.description:
In our team, we have a vision to change lives in novel ways. Our team's origin began with a Kiva Card (gift certificate) whose recipient founded this team. Inspired by Kiva Fellow, Jessica Heinzelman's talk, our founder dreamed to take us on a cruise, beyond the realm of lending targets and team statistics. Frequent & occasional lenders are free to choose who to lend to, how much and when in an amiable team ambience nurtured by Kiva Fellows, Kiva Editor & Translators, artists, writers, entrepreneurs, workers, retired people, families, parent + kid(s), students, teachers, and professionals. Our diversity & portfolio enable our discovery of social values inherent in the Kiva micro-lending ecosystem whose issues we debate objectively. Experienced members are gratified to enhance our grasp of nuances in lending. We wish to work with volunteers in the team, Kiva Friends, http://kivafriends.org and our supporters to engage in activities that promote Kiva. Our journey to strengthen and grow the Kiva ecosystem has room for more. JOIN NOW, and check out our team, to convince yourself that it can be your team too.

LINKS TO SEE ALSO:
1. Kiva Updates:http://www.kiva.org/updates/kiva 
2. KF Blogs:http://www.kiva.org/updates/fellows 

(Thanks Anh D Pham for letting LOTUS team on Kiva to use the exquisite image of the lotus flower you photographed in Vietnam)

teams.name: Safe Girls Team
teams.loan_because: By empowering girls and women in the fight for women's rights, poverty reduction, education and health promotion, we are helping to create a fairer and better world for everyone.
teams.description:
This team supports the work of Kiva, improving the lives of people around the world who have limited financial means, and who would not otherwise have the means to improve their lives, those of their families, and their communities.

We also raise awareness of the issues of  violence against girls and women including fgm, education, maternal health and human rights.

This month we deal with the issue of Human Trafficking, a problem fuelled by poverty, and one which affects millions of women and children every year.

 A video explanation of what Trafficking is:

www.no-trafficking.org/

 A personal account:

http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/europe/7243612.stm

Videos:

www.theguardian.com/global-development/audioslideshow/2013/dec/11/human-cost-sex-trafficking-prostitution-audio-slideshow

www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-18144333

This four week free of charge course on Human Trafficking begins on 20th August, 2014.

www.coursera.org/course/humantrafficking

 Detailed information about child trafficking:

www.childtrafficking.com/Content/sitemap.php

 To report a trafficking crime:

 In the USA:

www.fbi.gov/about-us/investigate/civilrights/human_trafficking

 In the UK:

https://crimestoppers-uk.org/get-involved/our-campaigns/national-campaigns/human-trafficking

Courses our team members might be interested in joining for free: 

Coursera:     
                                              
https://www.coursera.org/course/water 26th May, 2014

Edx:

Resilience https://www.edx.org/course/uwashingtonx/uwashingtonx-ecfs311x-becoming-resilient-1652#.UznR_Gco-M9  6th May,2014


We have been informed that “It is against Kiva’s terms of use http://www.kiva.org/legal/terms to use team message boards or personal lender pages for self-promotion or to solicit funding for things not related to Kiva.”

For anyone needing further information about Kiva's policy on people requesting money for themselves, other individuals or organisations on Kiva web pages please contact Kiva.

Safe Girls Team Captains.

teams.loan_because:
NEWS! In honor of International Women's Day, if you join our team, then make a loan and credit our team, we'll match your loan with one of our own!!*

We believe in the multiplier effect of supplying capital to women - supporting a woman in opening or growing a business enables her to buy food and housing for her family, send her children to school, and contribute to the welfare of her community.  We want to help put more women on the road to Financial Independence Through Entrepreneurship. Join the FITE!
* We'll match up to 3,000 loans.
teams.description: Dermalogica is the number one line of skin care products for professional skin therapists and consumers worldwide.

We spread the word about the need-to-know women in your city with our CRAVE guides. Our blog and social media provide valuable forums for sharing business tips and learning what women all around the world crave. CRAVE is your one stop shop for connecting with smart, successful women business owners and discovering new, innovative ways to boost your business!

teams.name: Mary's Gone Crackers
teams.description: Mary’s Gone Crackers offers delicious gourmet, organic, gluten-free, vegan food including unique crackers, pretzels (Sticks & Twigs) and the new "love Cookies."  Homemade recipes developed by Mary herself use only certified organic, kosher, whole-food ingredients.   Mary’s Gone Crackers is Conscious Eating. Available in grocery and natural food stores.

teams.name: Eileen Fisher
teams.loan_because: It's widely known Eileen Fisher started her company with $350 and a vision. Eileen will tell you it was much more. Find out how we support women entrepreneurs at www.eileenfisher.com.
teams.description: Eileen Fisher creates beautifully simple clothes designed to move with real life. With pure shapes and fine fabrics, they create sophistication, comfort—and style that lasts.

teams.name: Dansko
teams.loan_because: We give because we believe that creating opportunities for entrepreneurship enables sustainable independence.
teams.description: Established in 1990, Dansko has been a leader in providing all day comfort footwear, socks and apparel while standing at the forefront of ethical business practices. Founded by husband and wife team Mandy Cabot and Peter Kjellerup, Dansko is an employee owned company based in Pennsylvania. You can find Dansko products at over 2,500 premium US and international retail locations.

teams.name: Seventh Generation
teams.loan_because: Seventh Generation supports causes that work for positive change. Seventh Generation dedicates 10% of our pretax operating profits to non-profit groups focused on community, environment, women’s and family health, and responsible business. One of those groups is Sustainable Health Enterprises (SHE), an organization that is working with women in Rwanda to create businesses that manufacture and sell sanitary pads using locally-grown materials. Girls and adult women in Rwanda and other developing nations miss up to 50 days of school and work a year because they lack access to affordable sanitary pads.
teams.description: Seventh Generation is committed to becoming the world's most trusted brand of authentic, safe, and environmentally-responsible products for a healthy home. For 20 years, the closely held Burlington, Vermont-based company has been at the forefront of a cultural change in consumer behavior and business ethics.

teams.name: Isobel Coleman
teams.loan_because: Women entrepreneurs in Afghanistan, Pakistan and throughout the Middle East are courageously advancing their own educational, economic and political opportunities and bringing greater stability and prosperity to the region.  I document their efforts in my latest book, Paradise Beneath Her Feet: How Women are Transforming the Middle East – check it out at http://www.isobelcoleman.com/books
teams.description: We are focused on loaning to women in Afghanistan, Pakistan and throughout the Middle East

teams.name: TerraCycle
teams.description: TerraCycle is the world's leader in repurposing otherwise non-recyclable packaging and products into new consumer goods or eco-friendly building materials. TerraCycle runs free collection programs that pay schools and non-profits to collect over 35 different materials ranging from candy wrappers to glue bottles in the US, Canada, Mexico, Brazil, the UK and many other other countries worldwide.

teams.name: Julia Ormond
teams.loan_because: We all have a role to play in supporting solutions to combat slave labor.  ASSET (the Alliance to Stop Slavery and End Trafficking), the nonprofit I founded in 2007, believes microlending is an important first step in both empowering women, enabling children to go to school, and breaking the cycle of poverty that leads to slavery.

teams.name: To Catch A Dollar
teams.description:
To Catch a Dollar, a 2010 Sundance Film Festival selection, documents the birth of Grameen America and the effort to bring Nobel Peace Prize winner Muhammad Yunus’s revolutionary
microfinance program to the United States. 

The film features stories of women borrowers from around the world – with a focus here in the United States. It depicts the genius of the Yunus model, and its promise for America. It proves it is possible to meet the needs of Americans living without access to affordable financial services, and can fuel a social movement campaign that can go even further. The campaign showcases the state of poverty in the United States, the plight of those struggling to save and what steps can be taken toward solutions. The campaign identifies and addresses the root causes of financial inequality – why so many Americans are “unbanked” or financially unstable – in an effort to educate viewers about the potential for microfinance as a solution to a number of these pressing social challenges. 

Lastly, the campaign provides clear and sustainable calls to action that extend the reach of the film and its stories beyond the theater and into the lives of those who are living in poverty, those who are living on the edge of it – and those who can help.

teams.name: Geena Davis
teams.loan_because: We know that the collective impact of consumer action and socially responsible business practices can create far-reaching change. And, together we can multiply our impact to empower women around the world.
teams.description:
Founded in 2004, the Geena Davis Institute on Gender in Media and its programming arm See Jane work with entertainment creators and companies, educate the next generation of content-creators, and inform the public about the need to increase the number of girls and women in media aimed at children and to reduce stereotyping of both males and females. 

“Children need to see entertainment where females are valued as much as males.” Founder, Geena Davis

For more information: www.seejane.org and http://www.thegeenadavisinstitute.org/

teams.name: Poverty2Prosperity.org - Poverty-Escape
teams.loan_because: Poverty2Prosperity.org (P2P) is all about Poverty-Escape. Please join our fun team and put Poverty-Escape in the lead!  See how to get your I'm a Kiva Loaner Bracelet and more by participating on Team P2P - visit our web site for details!
teams.description:
One of P2P's major poverty-escaping projects is to participate in making microloans through the Kiva platform. See the web site for details on all of our projects. Also see our Perpetual Fund lender account which allows people to designate funds for perpetual loaning here on Kiva, http://www.kiva.org/lender/P2PPerpetualFund

We have a special purpose fund to keep loans from expiring. Please join us at http://poverty2prosperity.org/sosloans to see currently funding loans from the SOS Loan fund.

NOTE:  Poverty2Prosperity is also a non-profit, and any messages not related to Kiva or Poverty2Prosperity may be deleted.  If there is an idea you would like to share, contact one of the Team Captains to get permission.  Thank you for your consideration.

teams.name: NYC
teams.loan_because: the greatest city in the world should do it's part to help end poverty.
teams.description:
You can lend money through our team in two ways:
  • Lend money through Kiva and then at checkout count it towards the NYC team
  • Send a gift certificate to nyc.kiva.endowment@gmail.com This is our city's Kiva endowment. 100% of the money will be loaned out. This is a long-term Kiva account that is linked to the NYC Kiva lending page. As loans get repaid, the money will be recycled and reloaned. This is a great way to make a larger impact and to make our team’s presence more permanent.
    • In the spirit of Kiva, this endowment will be 100% transparent. Whenever you give money please tell us how you would like to be identified on our public google spreadsheet. You can see who is receiving money by looking at the endowment's lender page.

teams.description:
We are one human family, and we know that people can do good without believing in a god.

The Plus sign in the A+ Team logo reflects the fact that the team comprises Atheists, PLUS Agnostics, Skeptics, Freethinkers, Secular Humanists, and Non-Religious members.  A+ is also a symbol of excellence.

teams.name: Safe Girls Team
teams.loan_because: By empowering girls and women in the fight for women's rights, poverty reduction, education and health promotion, we are helping to create a fairer and better world for everyone.
teams.description:
This team supports the work of Kiva, improving the lives of people around the world who have limited financial means, and who would not otherwise have the means to improve their lives, those of their families, and their communities.

We also raise awareness of the issues of  violence against girls and women including fgm, education, maternal health and human rights.

This month we deal with the issue of Human Trafficking, a problem fuelled by poverty, and one which affects millions of women and children every year.

 A video explanation of what Trafficking is:

www.no-trafficking.org/

 A personal account:

http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/europe/7243612.stm

Videos:

www.theguardian.com/global-development/audioslideshow/2013/dec/11/human-cost-sex-trafficking-prostitution-audio-slideshow

www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-18144333

This four week free of charge course on Human Trafficking begins on 20th August, 2014.

www.coursera.org/course/humantrafficking

 Detailed information about child trafficking:

www.childtrafficking.com/Content/sitemap.php

 To report a trafficking crime:

 In the USA:

www.fbi.gov/about-us/investigate/civilrights/human_trafficking

 In the UK:

https://crimestoppers-uk.org/get-involved/our-campaigns/national-campaigns/human-trafficking

Courses our team members might be interested in joining for free: 

Coursera:     
                                              
https://www.coursera.org/course/water 26th May, 2014

Edx:

Resilience https://www.edx.org/course/uwashingtonx/uwashingtonx-ecfs311x-becoming-resilient-1652#.UznR_Gco-M9  6th May,2014


We have been informed that “It is against Kiva’s terms of use http://www.kiva.org/legal/terms to use team message boards or personal lender pages for self-promotion or to solicit funding for things not related to Kiva.”

For anyone needing further information about Kiva's policy on people requesting money for themselves, other individuals or organisations on Kiva web pages please contact Kiva.

Safe Girls Team Captains.

teams.name: Gangplank
teams.loan_because: We want to see the world be a better place for all entrepreneurs.
teams.description: We are entrepreneurs fighting to make our own businesses work, but want to give the same advantage to those around the globe that are less fortunate than we are.

teams.name: A million miles cycled
teams.loan_because:
I am cycling long distances for 2 weeks at a time as often as I can.I cycled from Paris to Chamonix as a test of will and now I'm cycling from Chamonix to Barcelona (950km!).

I want you to do the same and to be part of this team by cycling as well as lending as a team member.

The (humongous) aim is to cycle 1 million miles between us.
teams.description:
I will use this group to lend through whenever I cycle in the future and I want you to join me - not just by lending through the group but by cycling somewhere yourself and asking friends / family to lend through this group in support of YOUR trip!

My aim is to have our group of cyclists around the globe total a million miles.

teams.description:
At present we are busy with setting up foundation AHHR (Antillian Haitian Human Rights).  Foundation AHHR will help gone off the rails Antillian and  Haitian young people for a better future. To realise this I have I need your  financial help for this reason I ask YOU a one-off contribution/Donation  or each contribution is most welcome. With YOU help I can help gone off the rails Antillian and Haitian young people for 3 years to their return to an more better life. YOU contribution can help foundation AHHR makes possible and to stimulate contacts between gone off the rails Antillian and  Haitian young people for a better life, buying second hands are based on tables etc. etc. and primary long duration foods. YOU can be also one-off anonymous donateur.  

Thx for Your help.

teams.name: KivaFriends.org
teams.loan_because: we are a diverse group of people with diverse reasons for participating on Kiva.org, but with a unifying desire to alleviate poverty around the world through making microloans to the hard working poor.
teams.description: We are a community for lenders by lenders. We welcome Kiva.org lenders to participate in our lender forums at KivaFriends.org

teams.name: Paying It Forward
teams.loan_because: We feel our lives have benefitted from the generosity of others and want to "Pay It Forward' by helping others through Kiva loans.  Join us if you want to return some favours to the world.
teams.description: The cost of one 'dinner out for two' is enough for people working their way out of poverty to have the chance to improve their lives. Repaid loans can continue to be relent over and over into the future, helping many hundreds in our lifetimes.

teams.name: Poverty2Prosperity.org - Poverty-Escape
teams.loan_because: Poverty2Prosperity.org (P2P) is all about Poverty-Escape. Please join our fun team and put Poverty-Escape in the lead!  See how to get your I'm a Kiva Loaner Bracelet and more by participating on Team P2P - visit our web site for details!
teams.description:
One of P2P's major poverty-escaping projects is to participate in making microloans through the Kiva platform. See the web site for details on all of our projects. Also see our Perpetual Fund lender account which allows people to designate funds for perpetual loaning here on Kiva, http://www.kiva.org/lender/P2PPerpetualFund

We have a special purpose fund to keep loans from expiring. Please join us at http://poverty2prosperity.org/sosloans to see currently funding loans from the SOS Loan fund.

NOTE:  Poverty2Prosperity is also a non-profit, and any messages not related to Kiva or Poverty2Prosperity may be deleted.  If there is an idea you would like to share, contact one of the Team Captains to get permission.  Thank you for your consideration.
